column5: Looking good for open water on 17 May 18 at Little Vermillion Lake!https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/CAXX0606:1:CAhttp://sportsmanslv.com/

In a little more than three weeks, will be making the trip to Little Vermillion Lake CA @ Sportsman's Lodge. Hoping for some open water, I check the live view every morning.https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/CAXX0606:1:CAhttp://sportsmanslv.com/

the snow has taken a beating here this week and the lakes are starting to be covered with water so if you are lucky, and the weather stays warm you could be fishing, BUT i just checked the weather for here and on May 2 and 3 there is a forecast of snow. time will tell , hope it works out for you

May 16, I'll be looking for lawn chair tracks and used cigars atthe Bug River bridge. Bug River will be a dangerous spotfor pike as they head toward bigger water.Might even make a house call if the sun is still turned on.
Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday look like ice melting days in the Morson area...https://weather.com/weather/tenday/l/CAXX1857:1:CA 60's and rain!!!! Hopefully that spreads all over NW Ontario.
I'm feeling pretty darn good...now about my May 24 trip. Whew!
I'm feeling good about the opener.
Yep. Looking at the 10 day in Sioux Lookout, I think you are going to be just fine for opener. Warm temps plus rain = open water.
Hopefully it comes off the day before. We are heading up to the English River just NE of Kenora. Ice is usually off a day or two before LOW.

We are at Minnitaki on the 24th. Have been up there on opener where the ice came off the day before...actually the night before, so we really cut it close. I like it though, because it makes fishing locations pretty predictable. Good luck on your trip!
